name: Rukkhashava Mushrooms
desc:
[Version 1]

A fungus that grows in layers upon layers, like a sea of clouds, and which mostly grows on trees deep in the rainforest. Therefore, they are considered by the people of Sumeru to be the holy crystallization of Rukkhadevata's legacy.

[Version 2]

Complete Archon Quest Chapter III: Act V - Akasha Pulses, the Kalpa Flame Rises

Quest - Where the Boat of Consciousness Lies

A fungus that grows in layers upon layers, like a sea of clouds, and which mostly grows on trees deep in the rainforest.

value.text:
Found in the wild
Recommendation: Found in the Ashavan Realm
Recommendation: Found in Lokapala Jungle

customize.name: Ashpazi
customize.desc: A forest ranger in Gandharva Ville. He is a skilled cook and hunter.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Aramani
customize.desc: An Aranara found in Mahavanaranapna. Aramani will sell local specialties from Sumeru.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Wanderer
customize.desc: A wayfaring figure whose identity is a mystery. He dresses like a mountain ascetic, but he certainly does not act the part.

customize.name: Collei
customize.desc: A trainee ranger active in Avidya Forest. Behind her enthusiastic words and actions hides a slightly introverted personality.

customize.name: Dendroculus Resonance Stone
customize.desc:
A stone that can be used in Sumeru to search for nearby Dendroculi.

A curious amulet of a similar nature to the Dendro Statues of The Seven. By the same token, it is drawn to Dendroculi.

In the world, there are grass and trees, vines and flowers — living beings of Dendro Element that abound in diverse shapes and forms. Though differing in appearance and various other aspects, they were born from the same land and will return to the same land.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Nilotpala Lotus
customize.desc: Growing in the forest wetlands, these plants only bloom at night with flowers as bright as the moon.

customize.name: Crystal Chunk
customize.desc: An uncut crystal. Only professional craftsmanship can bring out its true value.

customize.name: Mushroom Hodgepodge
customize.desc: An Aranara-style dish that Paimon has drained her brain juice dry to improve. But in fact, it only requires a few common mushrooms from Sumeru, along with some extra seasonings. Paimon selected three types of mushrooms, and they were prepared and then cooked in a simple way, but the texture and flavor aren't bad at all.

customize.name: Mushroom
customize.desc: Hardy common fungi. Can grow anywhere with the right amount of shade and moisture.

customize.name: Starshroom
customize.desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It is quite hardy indeed. Once it matures, the center of the cap will split open.

customize.name: Forest Watcher's Choice
customize.desc: Tighnari's specialty. The Forest Watcher personally picked out these edible mushrooms — not only the common ones but also a few mysterious-looking shrooms that you have never seen before. No condiments were added, for the limelight should go to the ingredients' unmarred freshness. It must have taken him quite some time to prepare this delicious dish.

customize.name: Potato Boat
customize.desc: A baked appetizer. The potato was washed clean and then baked together with cheese and Rukkhashava Mushrooms. The dish guarantees an unmatched experience when eaten hot. This explains its popularity on the streets of Sumeru. Still, be careful not to burn your tongue.

customize.name: Potato
customize.desc: A chunky vegetable. A gift from the earth that you never tire of with its multitude of cooking methods.

customize.name: Cheese
customize.desc: Made from fermented milk. High in energy, it's used in a wide range of dishes.

customize.name: Tandoori Roast Chicken
customize.desc: A signature chicken dish of Sumeru. The chicken was first marinated with red spices, and then roasted in a tandoor. The process of making this Sumeru classic does not involve any fancy skills, and the use of such a humble clay oven might be surprising to some. In Sumeru, a tandoor to a veteran chef is as important as a trusty sword to an adventurer.

customize.name: Fowl
customize.desc: A fresh chunk of fowl. Handled properly, it can make a hearty meal.

customize.name: Padisarah
customize.desc: A holy and noble plant. The conditions for growth in its environment are very demanding. The flower buds can be processed to make valuable spices.

customize.name: Spice
customize.desc: A seasoning with varied flavors. It is made from dried Harra Fruits and can enrich the taste of a dish. Therefore, Sumeru locals say, "Spice goes well with anything."
